description: From Ancient Greek ὀστρακώδης (ostrakṓdēs, “covered with shell”), from ὄστρακον (óstrakon, “clay pot; shell”); compare translingual Ostracoda.

entries.meaning: Any of many small crustaceans, of the class Ostracoda, that resemble a shrimp enclosed in a bivalve shell.
examples: Considering all the ecological data, there seems to be an evolution in the associations of ostracods throughout time.
